intro: Heterostega curtipendula, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in racemes, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. The species is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
